intro: Clematis recta, commonly known as the straight clematis, is a deciduous vine native to eastern Asia. It features compound leaves with three to five leaflets and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white, pink, and blue. The plant is known for its vigorous growth and can reach lengths of up to 10 meters. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil. Clematis recta is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
